posts.author: RulesMaster
posts.content:
I've been thinking about combat lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about combat that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with combat and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about combat?

posts.author: DungeonMasterDave
posts.content:
The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of encounters to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for encounters are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that encounters functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about encounters. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with encounters that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: BardTales
posts.content:
In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how Balancing works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use Balancing to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

The way I understand the rules for Balancing, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.
